New Records: Arshdeep Singh achieved his career-best bowling figures of 4 for 9.
Key Match Events: India beat USA by seven wickets with ten balls to spare.
Arshdeep Singh took 4 wickets for 9 runs.
USA's Nitish Kumar and Steven Taylor set a competitive total of 110-8.
Saurabh Netravalkar dismissed Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma early in the innings.
A five-run penalty was given to the USA for breaching the sixty-second gap between overs.
Rishabh Pant was bowled by Muhammad Ali-Khan for 18.
Jasdeep was run-out on the last ball of the USA innings.
Pre-Game Insights: India won the toss and chose to field.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Jones reflected that the USA team was 10-15 runs short and praised the discipline of his team.
Rohit Sharma expressed happiness over India's qualification to the Super Eights and praised the progress of the USA team.
Arshdeep Singh expressed his pleasure with his performance and mentioned the team's support.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held in New York, and it was the last game in this stadium.
The pitch in New York was noted for not being conducive to high-scoring games.
